intro: Jaeschkea oligosperma, commonly known as the alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia and North America. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. It has small, oval leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Jaeschkea oligosperma is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
